reg_pit.acttitle: Financial Institutions and Credit Union Incorporation Acts
reg_pit.title: Financial Institutions Forms Regulation

change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 597/2004, effective December 31, 2004.

reg.acttitle: Financial Institutions and Credit Union Incorporation Acts
reg.title: Financial Institutions Forms Regulation

section.sectiontext: In this regulation Act means the Financial Institutions Act.
The return required under section 127 (1) of the Act must be in the same form as

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a trust company, the Annual Statement of Trust Companies prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as OSFI-33,

in the case of an insurance company authorized to carry on general insurance business, the Annual Statement by Canadian and Provincial Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Insurance Other Than Life Insurance prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as P&C-1,
in the case of an insurance company authorized to carry on life insurance business,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the Annual Statement by Canadian and Provincial Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Life/Accident and Sickness Insurance prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as OSFI-54, and

the Provincial Exhibits Required From Insurance Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Life Insurance and Accident and Sickness Insurance in Canada prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as OSFI-194, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of a credit union, Forms 1 and 2.

section.sectiontext: The report required under section 127 (3) of the Act must be

paragraph.paragraphtext: in Form 1 and 2 for credit unions, and
in Form 3.1 for trust companies authorized to carry on deposit business or both deposit business and trust business.

section.sectiontext: The return required under section 163 of the Act must be in the same form as

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of an extraprovincial trust corporation, the Annual Statement of Trust Companies, prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as OSFI-33,
in the case of an extraprovincial insurance corporation authorized to carry on general insurance business

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the Annual Statement by Canadian and Provincial Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Insurance Other Than Life Insurance prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as P & C-1, or

the Annual Statement by British and Foreign Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Insurance Other Than Life Insurance prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as P & C-2, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of an extraprovincial insurance corporation authorized to carry on life insurance business,

clause.clausetext: by Canadian and Provincial Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Life/Accident and Sickness Insurance prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as OSFI-54, or

by British and Foreign Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Life/Accident and Sickness Insurance prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as OSFI-55, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the Provincial Exhibits Required From Insurance Companies Registered or Licensed to Transact the Business of Life Insurance and Accident and Sickness Insurance in Canada prepared and published by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada and commonly referred to as OSFI-194.

section.sectiontext: The forms established as Forms 1 to 23 of the Second Schedule of the Company Act shall be remitted to the Registrar of Companies for those matters connected with the administration of the Company Act, as it applies for the purpose of the Financial Institutions Act or the Credit Union Incorporation Act.
Forms 4 to 13 are prescribed for all matters to which those forms refer.

Ministry of Finance and
Corporate Relations
FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS COMMISSION
This form is required pursuant to sections 62, 68, 127 and 289 of the FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS ACT.
This form must be typewritten or printed.
All applicable information must be provided. Attach additional typed / printed sheets as necessary.
Upon completion, please forward this form together with all attachments to the Financial Institutions Commission, Suite 1900, 1050 West Pender Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, V6E 3S7.
All material requested must be submitted at the same time.

Ministry of Finance and
Corporate Relations
FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS COMMISSION

tablecol.strong:
APPLICATION FOR BUSINESS
AUTHORIZATION
for Trust Companies, Insurance Companies,
and Credit Unions

tablerow.tablecol: This form is required pursuant to sections 61 (1), (4), (5), (6) and (7) of the FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS ACT.
This form must be typewritten or printed.
All applicable information must be provided. Attach additional typed / printed sheets as necessary.
Upon completion, please forward this form together with all attachments to the Financial Institutions Commission, Suite 1900, 1050 West Pender Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, V6E 3S7.
All material requested must be submitted at the same time.

A. APPLICANT DETAILS
Â
1. APPLICATION FOR BUSINESS AUTHORIZATION FOR:
Deposit Business Trust Business
Deposit and Trust Business Insurance Business
Â
2. NAME OF COMPANY/CREDIT UNION: .....................................................................................................
Â
3. HEAD OFFICE ADDRESS: ......................................................................................................................
Â
4. TELEPHONE NUMBER: ............................................. 5. FAX NUMBER: ..............................................
Â
6. INCORPORATION NUMBER: ...................................................................................................................
Â
7. (i) CONTACT PERSON: ..........................................................................................................................
Â
(ii) TITLE: ...............................................................................................................................................
Â
B. BUSINESS AUTHORIZATION FEES
Â
Attach the business authorization fee, in the amount set out in the Financial Institutions Fees Regulation, made payable to the Minister of Finance and Corporate Relations.
Â
C. DEPOSIT BUSINESSFOR DEPOSIT BUSINESS OR DEPOSIT AND TRUST BUSINESS APPLICANTS ONLY
Â
In the case of a trust company, attach a letter of 'no objection' from the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, or an approved deposit insurer.
Â
D. INSURANCE BUSINESSFOR INSURANCE BUSINESS APPLICANTS ONLY
Â
1. Business Authorization to be confined to: Life Insurance Business
General Insurance Business Life and General Insurance Business
Specific Class or Classes of Insurance
Â
2. Name of Actuary: ....................................................................................................................................
Â
3. Address: ................................................................................................................................................
Â
4. Telephone Number: .........................................................
Â
5. Attach a letter of no objection or evidence of membership from an approved insurance compensation plan in respect to classes of insurance permitted under business authorization.

Ministry of Finance and
Corporate Relations
FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS COMMISSION

tablecol.strong:
APPLICATION FOR ANNUAL PERMIT
For Reciprocal Exchanges

tablerow.tablecol: This form is required pursuant to section 187 (1) (a) of the FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS ACT.
This form must be typewritten or printed.
All applicable information must be provided. Attach additional typed / printed sheets as necessary.
Upon completion, please forward this form together with all attachments to the Financial Institutions Commission, Suite 1900, 1050 West Pender Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, V6E 3S7.
All material requested must be submitted at the same time.

A. APPLICANT DETAILS
Â
1. APPLICATION FOR:
Initial Permit Renewal of Permit
Â
2. NAME OF RECIPROCAL EXCHANGE .....................................................................................................
Â
3. HEAD OFFICE ADDRESS: ......................................................................................................................
Â
4. TELEPHONE NUMBER: ........................................... 5. FAX NUMBER: ...............................................
Â
6. (i) CONTACT PERSON: ..........................................................................................................................
Â
(ii) TITLE:...............................................................................................................................................
Â
B. BUSINESS PERMIT FEES
Â
Attach the annual permit fees in the amount set out in the Financial Institutions Fees Regulation, made payable to the Minister of Finance and Corporate Relations.
Â
C. MEMBERS OF RECIPROCAL EXCHANGE
Â
1. Attach any agreement(s) entered into by members.
Â
2. Attach forms of all policies and endorsements.
Â
3. List members of the reciprocal exchange:

Ministry of Finance and
Corporate Relations
FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS COMMISSION

tablecol.strong:
APPLICATION FOR BUSINESS
AUTHORIZATION
for Extraprovincial Corporations

tablerow.tablecol: This form is required pursuant to section 160 (1) of the FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS ACT.
This form must be typewritten or printed.
All applicable information must be provided. Attach additional typed / printed sheets as necessary.
Upon completion, please forward this form together with all attachments to the Financial Institutions Commission, Suite 1900, 1050 West Pender Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, V6E 3S7.
All material requested must be submitted at the same time.

Ministry of Finance and
Corporate Relations
FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS COMMISSION

This form is required pursuant to section 18 (2) (e), 29 (2) (c) 105 and 289 (3) (a) of the FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS ACT, and section 11 (3) (e) and 108 (2) (a) and (b) of the CREDIT UNION INCORPORATION ACT.
This form must be typewritten or printed.
All applicable information must be provided. Attach additional typed / printed sheets as necessary.
Upon completion, please forward this form together with all attachments to the Financial Institutions Commission, Suite 1900, 1050 West Pender Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, V6E 3S7.
All material requested must be submitted at the same time.
